p: Viboud et al. analyzed correlations for influenza epidemics from 1972 to 1997 in the U.S., France, and Australia [ 31]. In their study, France and the U.S. had a high correlation for influenza epidemics, but there was no significant correlation between the U.S. and Australia. In the scenario in which the influenza season in Australia was systematically six months in advance of that in the Northern Hemisphere, the median time lag between the peaks in Australia and in the United States was 27 weeks (range 14â€“39) [ 31]. Our study analyzed correlations for INF A and INF B, but the study of Viboud et al. did not [ 31].
